page.description: IS_OBJECT() returns .T. if Object_Pointer or Object_Address references a valid object. If you use IS_OBJECT() on a pointer variable without a value, the function will return FALSE (.F.).

prototypes.prototype: Result_Flag as L = IS_OBJECT(C object name)

argument.name: object
argument.description: The "name" of the object, as in " :customer:button1 ".

section.title: Example
section.description: This Interactive Window session illustrates how IS_OBJECT() works with pointers.
section.example: dim ptr as P ? is_object(ptr) = .F. ptr = form.load("Inventory") ? is_object(ptr) = .T.

section.description: The following command tests to see if a form called "customer" has a button called "Button1".
section.example: flag = is_object(":customer:button1") 'This does the same thing p = obj(":customer:button1") flag = IS_object(p)

section.description: This script opens a form named myform, but only if it is not already open.
section.example: if is_object("myform") then myform.show() myform.activate() else form.view("myform") end if
